key_points: Michigan beat Iowa 42-3 in the Big Ten Championship Game.
The victory marked Michigan's first Big Ten championship win in 17 years and secured their spot in the College Football Playoff for the first time.
Michigan honored Oxford High School shooting victim Tate Myre, who was number 42 on his high school football team.
The Wolverines wore a patch during the game to honor the victims, including Myre's number, 42.
Tate Myre was one of four students killed in a mass shooting at Oxford High School.
Myre died trying to stop the shooter, described as a hero by Michigan coach Jim Harbaugh.
Myre's family participated in the pregame coin toss wearing 'Oxford Strong' T-shirts.
Michigan's senior defensive end Aidan Hutchinson suggested dedicating the game to Tate Myre.
Aidan Hutchinson was named the game's most valuable player.
Michigan players and coach saw the final score of 42 points as a tribute to Tate Myre.
spokespersons: Aidan Hutchinson (Senior defensive end, Michigan Wolverines)
